question.body: Pressure on the neck near one of the carotid sinuses can cause unconsciousness because:

multiple_choice.choice: It physically blocks blood from flowing to the brain.
It mimics high blood pressure and results in vasodilation.
It mimics high blood pressure and results in vasoconstriction.
It causes the heart to stop beating.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The blood supply to the brain is redundant help to prevent a single blockage from stopping all flow.

Correct. The carotid sinuses have receptors that sense blood pressure. If external pressure is place on them it cause a reflex vasodilation to lower the blood pressure. Blood pressure can become so low a person could become dizzy and lose consciousness.
Incorrect. The carotid sinuses have receptors to sense blood pressure, if external pressure mimics high pressure they will react to lower blood pressure through vasodilation not vasoconstriction.
Incorrect. Pressure to the carotid sinuses will not signal the heart to stop beating, although it may slow the heart rate.
